# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. [Engineering] Battery units
- Check that the SMES units are anchored to the floor. - Check that the APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check the APC unit's current Load (W).
## 1.2. [Engineering] AME generator unit
- Check that the AME core is properly shielded. - Check that the AME controller unit is anchored to the floor. - Check the AME controller unit Fuel Status. - Check the AME controller unit Injection Amount (2 injections per core). - Toggle Injection if needed.
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. [Engineering] Distribution Loop
- Check that the O2 canister is anchored to connector port. - Check that the N2 canister is anchored to connector port. - Check that the gas mixer is set to the correct mixing ratio (primary port (Nitrogen): 79%, side port (Oxygen) 21%). - Check that the gas mixer is set to 101kPa. - Enable gas mixer if needed.
## 2.2. [EVA Access, starboard] Waste Loop
- Enable waste loop pump if needed.
## 3. Other checks
- [Engineering] Check that the gyroscopes are anchored, powered, and enabled. - [Engineering] Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled. - [Cargo Bay] Check that the blast doors are closed.
## Sidenotes
- Raven-class shuttles are equipped with two wallmount substations (one in Engineering, one on the Bridge) and three APC units (one outside Engineering, one in the mess corridor, one on the Bridge). Consult the Power Monitoring Computer on the Bridge for exact locations. - Power consumption chart for an unmodified Raven-class shuttle: -- 30 kW with full SMES units -- 44 kW with one empty SMES unit -- 69 kW with two empty SMES units -- 90 kW with two empty SMES units and empty substations
